Package system

Class VelibSystem

  • java.lang.Object
    • system.VelibSystem
  • public class VelibSystem
extends java.lang.Object
    Main class used by the myVelib project. It consists of the Java class representing a Velib Network, and also contains all the supplementary methods used by other classes whenever a reference to the system they were into was necessary.

    • Constructor Detail

      • VelibSystem

        public VelibSystem​(int N,
                   int M)
        First constructor created for a VelibSystem network; it should create N stations and have a total of M parking slots. If M is not divisible by N one station will have Floor(M/N) + M mod N stations. The stations are created with a default value of 70% occupation rate and 30% of electrical bikes.
        Parameters:
        N - Number of stations
        M - Total number of slots

      • VelibSystem

        public VelibSystem​(int N,
                   int M,
                   double s)
        Second constructor now adding the side of the square area where the network is deployed; see VelibSystem(int, int) for more details. The network is created with default 70% occupation rate and 30% electric bikes
        Parameters:
        N - Number of stations
        M - Total number of slots
        s - Side of the square area where the system is deployed

      • VelibSystem

        public VelibSystem​(int N,
                   int M,
                   double s,
                   double empty,
                   double regular,
                   java.lang.String name)
        Final version of the constructor, it should be prioritized for usage over the other two. Creates a myVelib network with N stations summing up to M parking slots with a custom percentage of occupation and a custom percentage of regular bikes.
        Parameters:
        N - Number of stations
        M - Total number of parking slots
        s - Side of the square area where the system is deployed
        empty - Desired percentage of empty slots. Due to rounding since the number of empty slots is an integer, the actual number of empty slots will be in fact at most the percentage given but may be slightly smaller
        regular - Desired percentage of regular bikes. Again the rounding observation applies and the rate of regular bikes will be at most equal to this percentage. In general it might be slightly smaller.
        name - Name given to identify the system

    • Method Detail

      • getStations

        public Station[] getStations()

      • setStations

        public void setStations​(Station[] stations)

      • getUsers

        public java.util.ArrayList<User> getUsers()

      • setUsers

        public void setUsers​(java.util.ArrayList<User> users)

      • getRideplan

        public RidePlanning getRideplan()

      • setRideplan

        public void setRideplan​(RidePlanning rideplan)

      • addUser

        public void addUser​(GPS location,
                    java.lang.String credit_card_number)
        Method for adding user to the system mainly used in testing. It gives the user an unique ID and sets all of its other attributes to null.
        Parameters:
        location - GPS oject with coordinates for the user
        credit_card_number - String containing the credit card identifier of the user

      • addUser

        public void addUser​(GPS location,
                    java.lang.String credit_card_number,
                    Card registrationCard)
        Same as addUser(GPS, String) but with the addition of a registration card for the user.
        Parameters:
        location - GPS object with coordinates for the user
        credit_card_number - String containing the credit card identifier of the user
        registrationCard - Card object with the registrationCard of the user, if he has any

      • addUser

        public void addUser​(java.lang.String name,
                    Card registrationCard)
        Method to add user to the system. It is the one used by the CLUI in the command addUser. In this method the user also gets a name to identify him, and his credit card is the same as his ID. This was made this way because of the lack of specifications concerning users credit card.
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the user being registered
        registrationCard - Card object representing the registration card of the added user

      • addUser

        public void addUser​(User usr)
        Used to add user to system only in testing context. The function is given directly an user object and should not be used outside of test environment.
        Parameters:
        usr - User to add to VelibNetwork.

      • PlanRide

        public Station[] PlanRide​(GPS start,
                          GPS finish,
                          java.lang.Class<?> bikeType)
        Uses the RidePlanning object belonging to the system to plan a ride to the user based on its stations. See RidePlanning
        Parameters:
        start - Start coordinate of the user
        finish - End coordinate of the user
        bikeType - Desired bike type for the ride
        Returns:
        Array of stations containing the two optimal stations for start and end, in this order.

      • getUserByBike

        public static User getUserByBike​(Bike b)
        Method for getting user in the ArrayList users of the system based on the bike he possesses
        Parameters:
        b - Bike object in which the search is based
        Returns:
        Null if no user registered in the system has that bike, else returns the user with the given bike

      • getStationBySlot

        public static Station getStationBySlot​(ParkingSlot slot)
        Method for getting a station based on a slot object. It uses the fact that in our implementation, whenever a system is set online, the parking slot ids are always station_id * 100 plus their position in the station
        Parameters:
        slot - ParkingSlot object being searched
        Returns:
        Station if there is a station with the provided ID, null otherwise.

      • getStationByBike

        public static Station getStationByBike​(Bike b)
        Method for getting a station based on a given bike. Uses the station method station.Station#getBikeByID(Bike).
        Parameters:
        b - Bike object to use for search
        Returns:
        Station object containing the bike in one of its slots, null otherwise. If the bike exists but is with an user, for example, it will return null

      • getUserByRegistrationCard

        public static User getUserByRegistrationCard​(Card c)
        Method for searching a user on the ArrayList users of the network based on its registration card.
        Parameters:
        c - Card Object with the registration card being searched
        Returns:
        User object if there is a user registered with that card, null otherwise

      • getStationByID

        public static Station getStationByID​(int id)
        Method for searching a station based on its ID
        Parameters:
        id - Integer for the station ID
        Returns:
        Station object having the given id or null if no such object exists

      • getUserByID

        public static User getUserByID​(int id)
        Method for searching a registered user based on its ID. In use context, all users have an unique ID because addUser(String, Card) ensures that.
        Parameters:
        id - Integer for User ID
        Returns:
        Returns the user with the corresponding ID if it is registered, null otherwise.

      • getUsersWithCreditCard

        public static java.util.ArrayList<User> getUsersWithCreditCard​(java.lang.String card_number)
        Gets all users that have credit card according to the string given. Since one credit card may be the same for different users, it returns an ArrayList of Users
        Parameters:
        card_number - String containing credit card number
        Returns:
        ArrayList of users having the provided card.

      • printSystemInfo

        public static void printSystemInfo()
        Method for printing in screen main system info such as stations, users, and rideplanning method

        public static int getN()

      • getM

        public static int getM()

      • getSquareLength

        public static double getSquareLength()
